folder: Thompson Street & Front Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Thompson Street, at Front Street (vantage point). The three views are south along the new Staten Island Railroad embankment llying between Bay Street (right) and Murray Hulbert Avenue. On the right, across the freight house, are buildings of the U. S. Marine Hospital on Bay Street. The gas tank is at Edgewater Street; to its left are the Clifton railroad repair shops and the spire of St. Mary's R. C. Church, at Rosebank; still farther left is the Pouch Terminal warehouse, the Wrigley chewing gum plant, and piers on Murray Hulbert Avenue.
May 25, 1935
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr
